授業目的:
The purpose of this CCM module is threefold:

To guide students towards developing a critical and practical appreciation of cross-cultural management (CCM)**

To examine and assess the extent to which processes of CCM represent organisation-specific responses to the business challenges and opportunities currently emerging in the global business environment

To identify - and rehearse – CCM practices that can serve towards improving e organisational performance

**Note: Also referred to as ‘Intercultural management’ (ICM)
到達目標:
By working actively and collaboratively through this course students should develop & be able to demonstrate:

A critical and practical understanding of the extent to which CCM practices might appear different and / or – on closer critical examination – similar

By working actively and collaboratively through this course students should develop & be able to demonstrate:

Insights, skills and competencies relevant towards demonstrating effective** cross-cultural leadership across geographical, organisational, institutional & other strategic contexts for domestic & international business and management.


**Keyword: Performance (cf. CCM Session #2)
授業方法:
Seven face-to-face class sessions.
Home study reading assignments (individual and group) with focus on a set textbook.
LUNA Discussion Forums on related class themes will be opened in between class sessions.

第2回: Exploring social and cultural identities in contexts for international management
第3回: Week #2: Comparing theories of culture and models of CCM
第4回: Cross-cultural management communication: examples and role plays
第5回: Week #3: Comparing processes of CCM and cross-cultural leadership
第6回: Case study discussion: simulation and role plays
第7回: Week #4: CCM and leadership in contexts for virtual project teams (VPTs)
第8回: Group discussion: VPTs - developing and expressing a global mindset
第9回: Week #5: Developing international managers as effective CCM practitioners
第14回: Developing a career as an effective CCM practitioner
